rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C177718

self.title: CDISC Questionnaire SF12 v2.0 Acute Test Code Terminology

definition: Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 test code.
name: Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire SF12 v2.0 Acute Test Code Terminology
synonyms: Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire Test Code

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - In general, would you say your health is.
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - In General You Say Your Health Is
synonyms: SF124-In General You Say Your Health Is

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - The following questions are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health now limit you in these activities?
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Limit Moderate Activities

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - How much does your health now limit you in - climbing several flights of stairs.
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Limit Climbing Several Flights

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - During the past week, how much of the time have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health - accomplished less than you would like.
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Physical: Accomplished Less

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - During the past week, how much of the time have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your physical health - were limited in the kind of work or other activities.
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Physical: Limited Kind of Work

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - During the past week, how much of the time have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious) - accomplished less than you would like.
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Emotional: Accomplished Less

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - During the past week, how much of the time have you had any of the following problems with your work or other regular daily activities as a result of any emotional problems (such as feeling depressed or anxious) - did work or other activities less carefully than usual.
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Emotional: Did Work Less Carefully

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - During the past week, how much did pain interfere with your normal work (including both work outside the home and housework)?
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Pain Interfere With Normal Work

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - Please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past week - have you felt calm and peaceful?
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Have You Felt Calm and Peaceful
synonyms: SF124-Have You Felt Calm and Peaceful

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - Please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past week - did you have a lot of energy?
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Did You Have a Lot of Energy
synonyms: SF124-Did You Have a Lot of Energy

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - Please give the one answer that comes closest to the way you have been feeling. How much of the time during the past week - have you felt downhearted and depressed?
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - You Felt Downhearted and Depressed

terms.definition: The Short Form 12 Health Survey Acute, US Version 2.0 - During the past week, how much of the time has your physical health or emotional problems interfered with your social activities (like visiting friends, relatives, etc.)?
terms.preferredTerm: SF12 v2.0 Acute - Time Physical Health, Emotional Interfered
